text: Hey, everybody, I need your help with Email Supporting In ALL  Gmail App. inside some gmail app I am Getting This Code, How to fixed that. only Gmail App
that is because you code exceeds 106kb in size

gmail caps the email at exactly that point displaying sometimes only half of the code which of course does not get rendered properly. The only way i found around this is to have a "less complex" email. This can be achieved with a reduction of module groups for example
Thank you! very much <@UBT0AHWLD> For Big help.
i have found a lot of help here too! Nice to help someone out by myself :slightly_smiling_face:

Trying to publish a global footer module in the design manager and I'm getting 1 error: resource not found. Anyone have any idea what this could be? The footer module only uses rich text modules in the drag and drop, its not even a custom module
Heya <@UDFSF3N1F>! Wanna DM me the global footer module, and I can take a look?

Hi! We have a client that we are doing a website redesign for, so we are building out a brand new template and modules. I was wondering if there’s a way to place the new modules into a category so the client can easily find the new modules we’ve created? When adding modules to the page, the current filters are All, Built-In, Global, & Custom. Is it possible to add a 5th option such as Client 2019?

There isn’t a way to add additional module types to categories. I would suggest either
- Using a prefix for each module so that the customer can easily filter by searching for the prefix. For example, you could title a module `Client 2019 - Image gallery`, `Client 2019 - Testimonial` and the client could filter the modules by simply searching `Client 2019`.
- Modules can be added to a template from the left sidebar as well as the ‘+ Add’ section of the right sidebar. If you group all of your modules into a folder (or subfolders) you can instruct your customer on how to navigate the left sidebar, locate the module folder(s) and add them from there.
<@UB7MPUTJ4>, this would be a nice addition to the <#C26E7JT8V|ideas> channel :slightly_smiling_face:
